**Basics of HTML, CSS & JS**

***When creating a web page, you add tags
(known as markup) to the contents of the
page. These tags provide extra meaning
and allow browsers to show users the
appropriate structure for the page.***

![imgg](https://image.slidesharecdn.com/basichtmlstructure-170404052141/95/basic-html-structure-3-638.jpg?cb=1491283386)

![imm](https://miro.medium.com/max/2084/1*R0qyXA3W09ffe2IMdoH8Ig.png)


![dd](https://www.script-tutorials.com/demos/531/structure.png)

**Structural markup:** the elements that you can use to describe both headings and paragraphs.

**Semantic markup:** which provides extra information; such
as where emphasis is placed in a sentence, that something
you have written is a quotation (and who said it), the meaning of acronyms, and so on.

![ss](data:image/png;base64,)

![Abbr](https://www.wikitechy.com/step-by-step-html-tutorials/img/html-images/code-explanation-abbreviation-tag-in-html.png)

**for address we can use the below**
![address](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/N_zhQhtJC64/maxresdefault.jpg)




![css](https://askatul.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Welcome-to-CSS.png)

**With CSS we can give spirit to our page and make it more attractive **

![Blooking&incline](https://www.digitalmarketingocean.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/incline-css.png)

***CSS allows you to create rules that control the
way that each individual box (and the contents
of that box) is presented.***

![csssyntax](https://www.studytonight.com/cascading-style-sheet/images/css-syntax-1.png)

![JS](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS7rMtZmBN1Pl_i22mOTcYf6t1jsDAagLH02A&usqp=CAU)


***JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification. JavaScript is high-level, often just-in-time compiled, and multi-paradigm. It has curly-bracket syntax, dynamic typing, prototype-based object-orientation, and first-class functions. Wikipedia***
